alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued November 17 at 3:08AM PST until November 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING BELOW 1500 FEET... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST FRIDAY BELOW 2500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Air Stagnation Advisory below 2500 feet, a period of stagnant air with light winds is expected. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility below a quarter of a mile in dense fog. * WHERE...South Willamette Valley and Cascade Foothills in Lane County. * WHEN...For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 10 PM PST Friday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 11 AM today. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility especially along and near the river bottoms. Air stagnation could result in the development and persistence of poor air quality. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Combination of freezing fog and cold temperatures will result in icy spots, especially on bridges and roads that are less traveled. Use caution in and around school zones and other pedestrian areas this morning.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. People with respiratory illness should follow their physician`s advice for dealing with high levels of air pollution during periods of stagnant air. State air quality agencies highly recommend that no outdoor burning occur and that residential wood burning devices be limited as much as possible. According to state air quality agencies, prolonged periods of stagnant air can hold pollutants close to the ground where people live and breathe. Check with your local burn agency for any current restrictions in your area.

area.areaDesc: Cascade Foothills in Lane County; South Willamette Valley
